title: Volumetric Analysis with Double Indicator
description: Determine the concentration of sodium carbonate solution using hydrochloric acid with phenolphthalein and methyl orange indicators

steps.title: Prepare the Burette
steps.description: Rinse the burette with hydrochloric acid solution and fill it to the zero mark
steps.instructions: Clean the burette with distilled water, then rinse with HCl solution. Fill to 0.00 mL mark

steps.title: Prepare the Sample
steps.description: Pipette 25.0 mL of sodium carbonate solution into a conical flask
steps.instructions: Use the pipette to transfer exactly 25.0 mL of Na₂CO₃ solution to the flask

steps.title: Add First Indicator
steps.description: Add 2-3 drops of phenolphthalein indicator to the solution
steps.instructions: Add phenolphthalein drops until the solution turns pink

steps.title: First Titration
steps.description: Titrate with HCl until the pink color disappears
steps.instructions: Slowly add HCl from the burette while swirling the flask. Stop when pink color disappears

steps.title: Record First Endpoint
steps.description: Record the burette reading at the first endpoint
steps.instructions: Note the volume of HCl used to reach the first endpoint

steps.title: Add Second Indicator
steps.description: Add 2-3 drops of methyl orange indicator to the same solution
steps.instructions: Add methyl orange drops to the solution in the flask

steps.title: Second Titration
steps.description: Continue titrating with HCl until the solution turns orange
steps.instructions: Continue adding HCl until the solution changes from yellow to orange

steps.title: Record Second Endpoint
steps.description: Record the total burette reading at the second endpoint
steps.instructions: Note the total volume of HCl used for both endpoints

criteria.description: How close the measured titre value is to the expected value
Proper use of apparatus and following procedure
Completing the experiment within reasonable time

firstEndpoint.description: Volume of HCl for first endpoint (phenolphthalein)

secondEndpoint.description: Total volume of HCl for second endpoint (methyl orange)

calculations.name: First Endpoint Calculation
calculations.formula: V1 = Volume of HCl for first endpoint
calculations.description: This represents the volume needed to convert Na₂CO₃ to NaHCO₃

calculations.name: Second Endpoint Calculation
calculations.formula: V2 = Total volume of HCl for second endpoint
calculations.description: This represents the volume needed to convert Na₂CO₃ to H₂CO₃

calculations.name: Concentration Calculation
calculations.description: Calculate the concentration of sodium carbonate solution

learningObjectives: Understand the concept of double indicator titration
Learn to use burette and pipette accurately
Understand the chemistry of carbonate titration
safetyNotes: Wear safety goggles and lab coat
tips: Ensure the burette is properly cleaned and rinsed
Add indicators drop by drop to avoid excess
Swirl the flask gently during titration
Take readings at eye level for accuracy
